generics.templates

Class GenericDomino<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • generics.abstractions.PairAbstraction
      • generics.templates.GenericPair<T>
        • generics.templates.GenericDomino<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PairSpecification
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DominoInt

    public class GenericDomino<T>
extends GenericPair<T>
    Extends GenericPair class. Represent a generic domino piece. Domino x:y is equal to Domino y:x. Domino is considered a double if x:x.
    Since:
    2017-04-26
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Patricia REINOSO

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GenericDomino(T fst, T snd)
      Construct a Generic Pair of objects from a given first and second value.

      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Check if 2 dominoes are equal.
      boolean isDouble()
      Check if a domino is a double.
      boolean matches(T val)
      Check if one of the sides of the domino matches (is equal to) a given value.
      boolean matches(T val1, T val2)
      Check if any of the sides of the domino matches (is equal to) any of the 2 given values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericDomino

        public GenericDomino(T fst,
                     T snd)
        Construct a Generic Pair of objects from a given first and second value. Use the superclass constructor.
        Parameters:
        fst - for the first value
        snd - for the second value

    • Method Detail

      • isDouble

        public boolean isDouble()
        Check if a domino is a double. A domino is a doble if the first and the second value are equal.
        Returns:
        True if the domino is a double. False otherwise.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Check if 2 dominoes are equal.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface PairSpecification
        Overrides:
        equals in class PairAbstraction
        Parameters:
        obj - is compared to this
        Returns:
        false if the object is null or not a domino, and true if the two values of both dominoes are the same even if they are swapped.

      • matches

        public boolean matches(T val)
        Check if one of the sides of the domino matches (is equal to) a given value.
        Parameters:
        val - value to compare with.
        Returns:
        True if there is a match. False otherwise.

      • matches

        public boolean matches(T val1,
                       T val2)
        Check if any of the sides of the domino matches (is equal to) any of the 2 given values.
        Parameters:
        val1 - first value to compare with.
        val2 - second value to compare with.
        Returns:
        True if there is a match. False otherwise.
